title: I'm interested in politics. I must choose between economics, law and philosophy. If I can only choose two of them, which should I choose? - Quora

response.answer_text: Economics problem is solved in the two lines below, so you don't need to study more. When we maintain cows and till the land with bulls, you have worlds richest economy. Now then , you are left with law and philosophy. You choose law and study to do the above, because govt will rob you land for road widening or HT power line projects , and will kill your cows for feeding the poor people. So with law you should protect the above economic development And study philosophy from His Divine Grace A.C Bhaktivedanta svami Prabhupada, then you pass out with flying colours Now if you make change in recipe don't expect any results, rest assured

At what stage in your life are you and what is the context of your question? Are you in kindergarten, do you have to do project in high school or are you up for a PhD at Stanford University? And may I suggest another subject for you to consider and to dedicate your life to: creation science. Because of the enormous amount of people in the US believing in creationism I think you'll have a nice big audience for your future publications about the subject. Must be easy to make a living out of it. Just follow into the footsteps of Kent Hovind.
